Shuntaro FURUTAKA (1829 - August 21, 1864) was among the patriots of the Joi-ha (supporters of the expulsion of foreigners).

sen.j: 文久元年、京都河原町通四条上ル東で諸藩御用達・枡屋を継ぎ古道具、馬具を扱いながら、早くから宮部鼎蔵らと交流し、長州間者の大元締として情報活動と武器調達にあたった。
sen.e: In 1861, he took over the Masuya with domain's warrant at Kawaramachi-dori Shijo Agaru Higashi, Kyoto to handle used articles and harness/trappings, and was engaged in information activities and the procurement of weapons as Omotojime (chief superintendent) for Choshu's spy having contact with Teizo MIYABE.

In 1861, he took over the Masuya with the domain's warrant at Kawaramachi-dori Shijo Agaru Higashi, Kyoto, in order to handle used articles and harnesses/trappings, but he was also engaged in information activities and the procurement of weapons as the omotojime (chief superintendent) for Choshu's spy, since he had contact with Teizo MIYABE.

In 1861, he took over the business of Masuya, a purveyor to various domains, at Shijo Agaru Higashi, Kawaramachi-dori Street, Kyoto, in order to handle used articles and harnesses/trappings, but he was also engaged in information activities and the procurement of weapons as the omotojime (chief superintendent) of the Choshu domain's spies, since he had contact with Teizo MIYABE.

sen.e: He had harsh interrogations directly from Isami KONDO, chief and Toshizo HIJIKATA, vice chief in a storehouse of Maekawa Residence, Mibu Tamurojo post, still existing.

sen.j: 二階から逆さ吊りにされ、足の甲から五寸釘を打たれ、それが突き抜けた足の裏の釘に百目蝋燭を立てられ火をつけられる過酷な拷問だったため、ついに古高も自白。
sen.e: Since FURUTAKA was terribly tortured with his body hung upside down from the second floor, Gosun-kugi long nails hammered in his insteps and lighting Hyakume-rosoku Candles placed on the nails penetrating his sole, he at last confessed himself.

FURUTAKA was severely tortured with his body hung upside down from the second floor, gosun-kugi (long nails) hammered into his insteps and Hyakume-rosoku candles placed on the nails penetrating his sole, so that ultimately he confessed.

sen.j: その内容は、八月十八日の政変後、京を追われた長州人らが六月下旬の強風の日を選んで御所に火を放ち、佐幕派公家の久邇宮朝彦親王を幽閉し京都守護職の松平容保以下佐幕派大名を殺害し、天皇を長州へ連れ去ろうとするものだった。
sen.e: The content of his confession was that after the Coups of August eighteenth, Choshu-jin (Choshu citizen,) etc. forced out of Kyo would set fire on the Imperial Palace on an certain very windy day in late June, confine Imperial Prince Asahiko KUNINOMIYA, Sabaku-ha (group of Feudal Government supporters) court noble, kill Katamori MATSUDAIRA and other Sabaku-ha Daimyo (feudal lords who support Feudal Government) and take away the Emperor to Choshu.

The content of his confession was that after the coup of August 18, the Choshu-jin (Choshu citizen,) etc. forced out of Kyo would set fire to the Imperial Palace on an certain very windy day in late June, thus confining Crown Prince Asahiko KUNINOMIYA and the Sabaku-ha (a group of feudal government supporters) court nobles; and would then kill Katamori MATSUDAIRA and other Sabaku-ha Daimyo (feudal lords who supported the feudal government) and take the Emperor to Choshu.

The content of his confession was that after the coup of August 18, the Choshu-jin (Choshu citizen,) etc. forced out of Kyo would set fire to the Imperial Palace on an certain very windy day in late June, thus confining Crown Prince Asahiko KUNINOMIYA, a Sabaku-ha (a group of feudal government supporters) court noble; and would then kill Katamori MATSUDAIRA and other Sabaku-ha Daimyo (feudal lords who supported the feudal government) and take the Emperor to Choshu.

sen.e: It was figured out that a number of patriots intending to execute the plan had gone to Kyoto and were hiding there and that such supporters would meet together in the town soon.

sen.j: 古高は六角獄舎に収容されたが、7月20日に禁門の変の際に生じたどんどん焼けは京都市中を焼き尽くし、獄舎近辺まで延焼。
sen.e: When FURUTAKA was being locked up in the Rokkaku prison house, Dondon-yake occurred at the time of Kimmon no Hen (Conspiracy of Kimmon) on July 20 burnt down inside Kyoto City and spread the fire close to the prison house.

When FURUTAKA was locked up in the Rokkaku prison house, the Dondon-yake--which occurred at the time of Kimmon no Hen (the Conspiracy of Kimmon) on July 20--burned through Kyoto City, and the fire spread close to the prison house.

When FURUTAKA was locked up in the Rokkaku prison house, the Dondon-yaki fire--which occurred at the time of Kinmon no Hen (the Conspiracy of Kinmon) on August 21--burned through Kyoto City, and the fire spread close to the prison house.

sen.j: 火災に乗じて逃亡することを恐れた役人により、他の囚人とともに斬首となった。
sen.e: Officials who were frightened about the escape of the prisoners under the fire beheaded him together with other prisoners.
Officials who were frightened about the escape of those incarcerated due to the fire beheaded Furutaka together with other prisoners.
